characters.name: Dr. Jonathan Swift
characters.description: Author of the proposal, presents himself as someone who has studied the problem of poor children in Ireland for many years

characters.name: the Pretender
characters.description: A political figure and historical claimant to the throne that Papists allegedly support to take over the kingdom, mentioned as someone Irish children might fight for in Spain

characters.name: a principal gentleman in the county of Cavan
characters.description: Unnamed gentleman who provided information about children's criminal activities, claiming expertise on the subject

characters.name: a very knowing American
characters.description: Swift's acquaintance in London who allegedly informed him that young children make good food

characters.name: a grave author, an eminent French physician
characters.description: Unnamed French physician cited as authority on birth patterns related to diet and Catholic practices

characters.name: A very worthy person
characters.description: Described as a true lover of his country whose virtues Swift esteems, suggested expanding the scheme to include older children

characters.name: Psalmanaazor
characters.description: Described as famous and a native of the island Formosa, apparently influenced the worthy person's suggestions

characters.name: my friend
characters.description: A person who told the narrator about customs in his country regarding execution and cannibalism

characters.name: plump girl of fifteen
characters.description: A young woman who was crucified for attempting to poison the Emperor and whose body was sold as food

characters.name: the Emperor
characters.description: The ruler who was the target of a poisoning attempt

characters.name: prime minister of state
aliases: his imperial majesty's prime minister of state
characters.description: High-ranking government official who purchased human flesh

characters.name: great mandarins of the court
characters.description: Court officials who purchased human flesh

characters.name: Lord Mayor
characters.description: Municipal leader mentioned in context of public feasts

characters.name: the reader
characters.description: The audience being addressed by the narrator

characters.name: Laplanders
characters.description: People from Lapland, mentioned as comparison for patriotism

characters.name: inhabitants of Topinamboo
characters.description: People from Topinamboo, mentioned as comparison for patriotism

characters.name: the Jews
characters.description: Historical reference to people fighting among themselves during a siege

characters.name: Unnamed narrator
characters.description: The speaker/narrator of the text

characters.name: Unnamed wife
characters.description: The narrator's wife who is past child-bearing age

characters.name: Unnamed child
characters.description: Nine years old child, relationship to narrator unclear from this excerpt

book_metadata.title: and for making them beneficial to the publick.
book_metadata.author: Dr. Jonathan Swift
